channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Even With $100 Million, WHO Says It Will Take Months To Control Ebola
item.description: The WHO has called for donations to help contain the outbreak. But money is just the first step. The challenges run from finding the right staff to prepping neighboring countries just in case.
item.content:encoded:
The WHO has called for donations to help contain the outbreak. But money is just the first step. The challenges run from finding the right staff to prepping neighboring countries just in case.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Richard Harris

item.title: Russian Military Vehicles Reportedly Move Into Ukraine
item.description: Heavy fighting continues in eastern Ukraine, as government and separatist forces still fight for control of the cities of Luhansk and Donetsk.
item.content:encoded:
Heavy fighting continues in eastern Ukraine, as government and separatist forces still fight for control of the cities of Luhansk and Donetsk.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson

item.title: Massive Rallies Descend On Islamabad, As Authorities Dig In Trenches
item.description: Thousands of people are converging on Pakistan's capital, Islamabad, for a protest rally against the government. The protesters began their 300-mile march in Lahore, led by Imran Khan, who believes he was robbed of last year's election by voting fraud. Meanwhile, a populist cleric is leading a separate march on the capital.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of people are converging on Pakistan's capital, Islamabad, for a protest rally against the government. The protesters began their 300-mile march in Lahore, led by Imran Khan, who believes he was robbed of last year's election by voting fraud. Meanwhile, a populist cleric is leading a separate march on the capital.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Philip Reeves

item.title: U.S. Policy On Syria Mired In Excess Caution, Official Says
item.description: Rick Barton, a top State Department official, says sometimes the U.S. has to take risks in diplomacy. Citing his own frustrations, he says that the Obama administration has yet to come up with a real strategy to resolve the war in Syria and isolate jihadi fighters.
item.content:encoded:
Rick Barton, a top State Department official, says sometimes the U.S. has to take risks in diplomacy. Citing his own frustrations, he says that the Obama administration has yet to come up with a real strategy to resolve the war in Syria and isolate jihadi fighters.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: In Defense Of U.N. Aid In Iraq
item.description: For more on the challenges of supporting internally displaced persons in Iraq, Robert Siegel speaks with Kieran Dwyer, the spokesman for the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs. Dwyer responds to criticisms of the U.N. agencies trying to help.
item.content:encoded:
For more on the challenges of supporting internally displaced persons in Iraq, Robert Siegel speaks with Kieran Dwyer, the spokesman for the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs. Dwyer responds to criticisms of the U.N. agencies trying to help.

» E-Mail This

item.title: EU OKs Arms Shipments To Iraqi Kurds
item.description: In an emergency meeting in Brussels, the European Union also called for an investigation into possible crimes against humanity carried out by Islamic State militants.
item.content:encoded:
In an emergency meeting in Brussels, the European Union also called for an investigation into possible crimes against humanity carried out by Islamic State militants.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Indonesian Police Detain U.S. Couple In Murder Probe
item.description: A 19-year-old woman and her 21-year-old boyfriend are being held in connection with the brutal death of the woman's mother on the resort island of Bali.
item.content:encoded:
A 19-year-old woman and her 21-year-old boyfriend are being held in connection with the brutal death of the woman's mother on the resort island of Bali.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Kiev: Russian Armor Destroyed After Crossing Border
item.description: Ukraine's president said a "significant" part of a Russian armored column said to have crossed the border overnight was destroyed by Kiev's artillery.
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine's president said a "significant" part of a Russian armored column said to have crossed the border overnight was destroyed by Kiev's artillery.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Radio In Liberia Seems Like It's All Ebola, All The Time
item.description: Deejays talk about it. Singers sing about it. Press conferences are broadcast live. Liberia's radio stations are devoting much of their airtime to spreading the word: Ebola is real.
item.content:encoded:
Deejays talk about it. Singers sing about it. Press conferences are broadcast live. Liberia's radio stations are devoting much of their airtime to spreading the word: Ebola is real.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: HitchBOT Makes Its Way Across Canada
item.description: A college professor sent a robot hitchhiking across Canada. He put HitchBOT by the side of the road with its thumb out. People pick up the robot and take it to its next destination.
item.content:encoded:
A college professor sent a robot hitchhiking across Canada. He put HitchBOT by the side of the road with its thumb out. People pick up the robot and take it to its next destination.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Iraq Has New Leadership, Al-Malaki Will Step Aside
item.description: Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki has agreed to step down. Maliki said he is not seeking a post in the new government and that he supports the nomination of Haider al-Abadi to succeed him.
item.content:encoded:
Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki has agreed to step down. Maliki said he is not seeking a post in the new government and that he supports the nomination of Haider al-Abadi to succeed him.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Peter Kenyon

item.title: Panama Canal Symbolizes U.S. Geopolitical, Technological Power
item.description: Steve Inskeep talks to Harvard professor Noel Maurer about the Panama Canal which opened 100 years ago. One of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World, it connected the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.
item.content:encoded:
Steve Inskeep talks to Harvard professor Noel Maurer about the Panama Canal which opened 100 years ago. One of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World, it connected the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

» E-Mail This

item.title: China's Wanda Group Branches Out Into Entertainment
item.description: A Chinese company this week made a play to become what could be likened to The Walt Disney Company of China. Steve Inskeep talks to Clifford Coonan, Asia bureau chief for The Hollywood Reporter.
item.content:encoded:
A Chinese company this week made a play to become what could be likened to The Walt Disney Company of China. Steve Inskeep talks to Clifford Coonan, Asia bureau chief for The Hollywood Reporter.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Russian Aid Convoy Parked Near Ukraine Border
item.description: A humanitarian aid convoy from Russia has reached the border with Ukraine. Russia is suspected of using the convoy to extend its influence there. Ukraine is battling a pro-Russian rebellion.
item.content:encoded:
A humanitarian aid convoy from Russia has reached the border with Ukraine. Russia is suspected of using the convoy to extend its influence there. Ukraine is battling a pro-Russian rebellion.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson

item.title: Has An Ebola Corner Been Turned? One Perspective: 'No, No, No, No'
item.description: A health educator working in Sierra Leone says her organization, Doctors Without Borders, is "at max capacity" and more help is needed to control an outbreak that is still raging.
item.content:encoded:
A health educator working in Sierra Leone says her organization, Doctors Without Borders, is "at max capacity" and more help is needed to control an outbreak that is still raging.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff
